agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Urban Affairs TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 11, 2019 PLACE: E2.010 CHAIR: Rep. Angie Button The Committee will meet to hear the following: HB 538 Murphy Relating to the provision of alarm system services by certain municipalities. HB 2446 Swanson Relating to the availability of personal information of firefighters, volunteer firefighters, and emergency medical services personnel. HB 2461 Stucky | et al. Relating to the territory of and fees imposed by certain emergency communication districts. HB 2564 White Relating to addressing the needs of homeless youth. HB 3180 Bowers Relating to the establishment of a centralized homelessness crisis response data system. HB 3732 Thompson, Senfronia | et al. Relating to the creation of an urban land bank by certain municipalities; granting authority to issue bonds. HB 3859 Johnson, Jarvis | et al. Relating to mental health assessment programs for certain municipal police and fire departments. HB 4249 Kuempel Relating to fees a municipality may charge certain air conditioning and refrigeration contractors. HB 4394 Johnson, Eric Relating to the administration by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs of homeless housing and services programs. HB 4680 Stephenson Relating to the creation of the Gateway Park Municipal Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4694 Cole Relating to the creation of the SH130 Municipal Management District No. 1; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4706 Holland Relating to the creation of the Dynavest Municipal Management District No. 1; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
